articles.title: Imran Khan to challenge graft conviction in Pakistan high court
articles.description: Former prime minister was sentenced to three years in jail and disqualified from politics
articles.content:
Pakistan’s former prime minister Imran Khan has challenged his conviction on graft charges in a high court, his lawyer said.
Naeem Panjutha said the petition to appeal against the conviction at the weekend had been filed in Islamabad on Tuesday.
Khan... [1063 chars]

articles.description: In today’s letters to the editor: African politics; the Northwest Passage; wildfires; foreign-trained physicians; copyright in Canada; BCE; supply management
articles.content:
Colonial history
Re “France’s ‘Africa problem’ is Canada’s, too” (Aug. 3): France has long sought to maintain a level of influence on its former West African colonies that Canadians would never dream of tolerating from Britain.

articles.title: Politics latest: Migrant barge described as 'floating example of catastrophic failure' as ministers target 'unscrupulous' immigration lawyers
articles.description: The home secretary and justice secretary have announced a "task force" to root out dodgy lawyers after reports that false asylum claims are being submitted for a fee. But Labour says it's "too little too late", blaming Tories for "chaos" in the immigration system.

articles.title: Today in Politics: All eyes on no-trust showdown in LS, Haryana Cong brass head to Nuh, anti-UCC move in Kerala House
articles.description: Rahul Gandhi's return as MP boosts Oppn as he will be one of its key speakers, although the outcome of no-confidence motion is a foregone conclusion given Modi govt's overwhelming numerical edge.
articles.content:

articles.title: Walter Sofronoff to hold talk about Higgins, Lehrmann inquiry
articles.description: Walter Sofronoff KC, the former judge who led the inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann’s trial before being accused of leaking his own report, will break his silence over the fallout in a speech on “politics, journalism and social media vs the presumption of innocence”.
